Rite of Contrition

Rite of Accord (Level 1)

Time: 20 minutes
Cost: 1 Gnosis (spent on attempt)
Focus: A meaningful apology, offering, or symbolic act tied to the offense
Participants: One Garou (others may witness)

Roll: Gnosis Roll (d20 + Max Gnosis rating)
DC: 12 (minor offense) or 14 (serious offense)

On Success: For 24 hours, advantage on one Charisma-based check to seek forgiveness, negotiate reparations, restore trust, or resolve social/spiritual conflict with the subject of the offense. Applies once, only for interactions related to the acknowledged wrongdoing.

Limitations: Does not compel forgiveness; does not remove penalties/curses/sanctions; no effect on creatures incapable of social interaction; cannot be repeated for the same offense; bad faith or repetition loses benefit immediately.

On Failure: Gnosis spent. Apology rejected. Further attempts to resolve the same offense within 24 hours are made at disadvantage.

description.value:
Rite of Contrition
Rite of Accord • Level 1

Gnosis Cost: 1
Time: 20 minutes
Resolution: Gnosis Roll
DC: 12 (minor offense), 14 (serious offense)
Participants: One Garou (others may witness)
Focus: A meaningful apology, offering, or symbolic act tied to the offense

Purpose

The Rite of Contrition is performed to formally acknowledge wrongdoing and open the possibility of reconciliation after a breach of trust, custom, or spiritual obligation.

This Rite does not erase consequences. It creates a brief opportunity for resolution without escalation.

Effect

On a successful Gnosis roll, for the next 24 hours, the Garou gains advantage on one Charisma-based check made to seek forgiveness, negotiate reparations, restore trust, or resolve a social or spiritual conflict with the specific creature, group, or spirit that was the subject of the offense.

This advantage applies only once, and only for interactions directly related to the acknowledged wrongdoing.

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Does not compel forgiveness or compliance
  • Does not remove penalties, curses, or sanctions by itself
  • Has no effect on creatures incapable of social interaction
  • Cannot be repeated for the same offense
  • If the Garou acts in bad faith or repeats the offense, the benefit is lost immediately

Failure

On a failed Gnosis roll:

  • The Gnosis is spent
  • The apology is rejected
  • Further attempts to resolve the same offense within 24 hours are made at disadvantage
  • Failure never worsens the original offense beyond social or spiritual consequence
